entities.name: horcruxes
entities.description: Horcruxes are objects that contain pieces of Voldemort's soul. They are mentioned as a way for Voldemort to become invincible by killing the person who is destined to defeat him, in this case Harry Potter.

entities.name: nagini
entities.description: Nagini is a snake and one of Voldemort's Horcruxes. She is mentioned as being used by Voldemort to kill an old Muggle man, and later turned into his last Horcrux.

entities.name: lord voldemort
entities.description: Lord Voldemort is the main antagonist of the story. He is mentioned as believing that killing Harry Potter would make him invincible and destroy the danger outlined in the prophecy.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is the main protagonist of the story. He is mentioned as being destined to defeat Voldemort, and his death would have been a significant event for Voldemort.

entities.name: slytherin connection
entities.description: The Slytherin connection refers to the fact that Nagini is a snake and one of Voldemort's Horcruxes, which enhances his mystique.

entities.name: muggle man
entities.description: An old Muggle man who was killed by Nagini at the behest of Voldemort.

relationships.description: Voldemort has control over Nagini, even for a Parselmouth. He likes to keep her close and seems to have an unusual amount of control over her.
Voldemort believed that killing Harry Potter would make him invincible and destroy the danger outlined in the prophecy.
